meanings.def: a piece of equipment producing a flow of water that you stand under to wash yourself; the small room or part of a room that contains a shower
examples: in the shower He's in the shower.
I've just got out of the shower.
an en-suite shower room
a shower cubicle/curtain
an electric shower
a hotel room with bath and shower
She was getting into the shower when the doorbell rang.
After the game, the boys hit the showers.
He could hear the shower running in the bathroom.
The plans include changing facilities and shower blocks.

meanings.def: the act of washing yourself with a shower
examples: a hot/cold shower
(especially British English) to have a shower
(especially North American English) to take a shower
shower gel

meanings.def: a short period of rain or snow
examples: scattered/heavy showers
April showers
We were caught in a heavy shower.
There's a chance of showers this afternoon.
rain/snow showers
wintry showers (= of snow)
shower of something a shower of rain/hail/hailstones

meanings.def: a large number of things that arrive or fall together
examples: a meteor shower
a shower of leaves
a shower of sparks from the fire
a shower of kisses
He pushed the couch so that it banged against the wall and released a shower of dust.
The white seeds drifted down in a slow shower against the blue sky.

meanings.def: a party at which you give presents to a woman who is getting married or having a baby
examples: a bridal/baby shower
I got a shower invitation from Katie.
A bridal shower is usually organized by the bridesmaids.

meanings.def: to wash yourself under a shower
examples: She showered and dressed and went downstairs.
He had already showered by the time they got home.

meanings.def: to fall onto somebody/something, especially in a lot of small pieces
examples: Volcanic ash showered down on the town after the eruption.

meanings.def: to drop a lot of small things onto somebody
examples: The bride and groom were showered with rice as they left the church.
The roof collapsed, showering us with dust and debris.

meanings.def: to give somebody a lot of something
examples: shower somebody with something He showered her with gifts.
shower something on somebody He showered gifts on her.
